radiographic_examinations.findings: Residual oral contrast is visualized within the colon and rectum. There is a normal bowel gas pattern without evidence of small bowel dilatation. There is no evidence of obstruction. No free air is identified to suggest perforation. There is diffuse demineralization of the bones. Degenerative changes are seen in the lower lumbar spine.
Bilateral pleural effusions and bibasilar infiltrates consistent with atelectasis.
Enlargement of the pancreatic head with associated stranding. Fluid in the mesentery, paracolic gutters, and in the pelvis.
